column4: how can I generate the md5sum of a normal input? Somehow, I just don't get it. I tried md5sum foobar
you want the md5sum of stdin?
yep
just don't specify a file
ok, but then I enter something, when does md5sum know when the input is finished?
ctrl+d
cool, txh
ctrl+d = EOF
ok but I have to use a "Return" at the end of the line, otherwise, it doesn't stop
you only need ctrl+d
oh actually you're right, it does seem to want a return
I enter md5sum, then enter a text, then press ctrl-d but it doesn't output it.
so just press enter
but doesn't that add some additional chars?
no
you can test it by making a file containing some text and then manually typing it in, it will be the same
what does "test" give you? then try the one with an enter.
d8e8fca2dc0f896fd7cb4cb0031ba249
both were the same
http://petrus.homeftp.org/scripting/utilities/md5/md5.php <-- here it gives me a different value.
it is not the same.
it is
you are doing it wrong if it is not the same
do it like this: cat | md5sum
